alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Menifee; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A gusty outflow boundary will impact portions of central Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, Bath, northern Menifee, southeastern Fleming, Rowan and northern Elliott Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary along a line extending from near Triplett to Stepstone to near Wades Mill. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Walkers Crossing, Oggs Station, Lower Spencer, Upper Spencer, Coons Station and Olympia Springs around 700 PM EDT. Jeffersonville, Camargo, Hope and Christy around 705 PM EDT. Elliottville, Clay Lick, Cedar Groves, Vale, Crix and Sudith around 710 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Frenchburg, Wagner Store, Wagner, Farley, Cornwell, Hamm, Rothwell, Pelfrey, Stark, Minor, Lytten, Fannin Valley, Craney, Sandy Hook, Blairs Mills, Leisure and Blaze. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
